## **Maternal Smoking During Pregnancy: America's Ongoing Crisis** 
### An in-depth look at the impact of maternal lifestyle choices on APGAR scores and birth weights in the United States

<hr>
#### **Motivations for the exploration:**
<div style="text-align: left; width: 800px; margin: 0 auto;">

As noted by Yang et al. (2014), maternal smoking is a significant health concern in the United States. Smoking during pregnancy has ramifications at both the individual level and at the societal level. From an individualistic perspective, smoking is known to be one of the most serious risk factors for poor pregnancy outcomes—having consequences for both the mother and the child. On a large-scale societal level, maternal smoking has been determined to increase economic costs. In 1994, the CDC reported that smoking during pregnancy led to more than $366 M in neonatal expenditures; this cost equates to approximately 704 dollars per maternal smoker. Maternal smoking during pregnancy is a highly preventable risk factor, despite its widespread prevalence. 

Thus, Group 14 was interested in taking a closer look into the current landscape of maternal smoking in the United States through the lens of health outcomes for the infant—specifically exploring birth weight and APGAR scores as metrics. Beyond smoking as a risk factor, we also explored a wealth of other variables that relate to infant health outcomes—such as the BMI of the mother.

```{r, echo=FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, results='asis', results='hide'}
#| echo: FALSE
num_rows <- nrow(data)
num_columns <- ncol(data)

# extracting specific columns I need
filtered_data_smoking <- data %>%
  select(cig0_r, cig1_r, cig2_r, cig3_r, apgar5, apgar10, mracehisp, dbwt) %>%
  filter(
    cig0_r != 6,
    cig1_r != 6,
    cig3_r != 6,
    apgar5 != 99,
    apgar10 != 88,
    apgar10 != 99,
    mracehisp != 8,
    dbwt != 9999
  ) %>%
  rename(Before_Pregnancy = cig0_r, Trimester_One = cig1_r, Trimester_Two = cig2_r, Trimester_Three = cig3_r, APGAR_FIVE = apgar5, APGAR_10 = apgar10, Birthweight_KG = dbwt) %>%
  
  mutate_at(vars(Before_Pregnancy, Trimester_One, Trimester_Two, Trimester_Three), ~case_when(
    . == 0 ~ "Nonsmoker",
    . == 1 ~ "1-5",
    . == 2 ~ "6-10",
    . == 3 ~ "11-20",
    . == 4 ~ "21-40",
    . == 5 ~ " 41 or more",
    TRUE ~ as.character(.)
  )) %>%
  
  rename(Race = mracehisp) %>%
  
  mutate(Race = case_when(
    Race == 1 ~ "White (only)",
    Race == 2 ~ "Black (only)",
    Race == 3 ~ "AIAN (only)",
    Race == 4 ~ "Asian (only)",
    Race == 5 ~ "NHOPI (only)",
    Race == 6 ~ "More than one race (non-hispanic)",
    Race == 7 ~ "Hispanic (only)",
    TRUE ~ as.character(Race)
  ))%>%

  mutate(Birthweight_KG = Birthweight_KG / 1000)
```

```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, results='asis'}
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(RColorBrewer) 
# Read data
data_2016 <- read_csv(here::here('dataset-ignore', 'natality_csv_2016.csv'))
data_2014 <- read_csv(here::here('dataset-ignore', 'natality_csv_2014.csv'))
data_2021 <- read_csv(here::here('dataset-ignore', 'natality_csv_2021.csv'))

#print(nrow(data_2016))

# Combine data frames into a list
data_list <- list(data_2016, data_2014, data_2021)

# Define a function to clean and filter data
clean_and_filter_data <- function(df, year) {
  df %>%
    select(cig_1, cig_2, cig_3, mracehisp) %>%
    filter(
      cig_1 != 99,
      cig_2 != 99,
      cig_3 != 99,
      mracehisp != 8
    ) %>%
    mutate(smoker = ifelse(cig_1 != "0" | cig_2 != "0" | cig_3 != "0", TRUE, FALSE),
           Year = year) %>%
    rename(Race = mracehisp) %>%
    mutate(Race = case_when(
      Race == 1 ~ "White",
      Race == 2 ~ "Black",
      Race == 3 ~ "AIAN",
      Race == 4 ~ "Asian",
      Race == 5 ~ "NHOPI",
      Race == 6 ~ "More than one race",
      Race == 7 ~ "Hispanic",
      TRUE ~ as.character(Race)
    ))
}

# Apply the filter to all data frames
filtered_data_list <- mapply(clean_and_filter_data, data_list, year = c(2016, 2014, 2021), SIMPLIFY = FALSE)

# Combine filtered data frames into a single data frame
all_data <- bind_rows(filtered_data_list)


result <- all_data %>%
  group_by(Year, Race) %>%
  summarize(PercentageSmokers = mean(smoker) * 100)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, results='asis', results = 'hide'}

filtered_data_smoking <- data %>%
  select(cig0_r, cig1_r, cig2_r, cig3_r, dbwt) %>%
  filter(
    cig0_r != 6,
    cig1_r != 6,
    cig3_r != 6,
    dbwt != 9999
  ) %>%
  
  # Yes_cigarettes_ is cigarettes for trimester 3, it's labelled like this so it makes sense in the final output of the model
  rename(
    Before_Pregnancy = cig0_r,
    Trimester_One = cig1_r,
    Trimester_Two = cig2_r,
    Yes_cigarettes_ = cig3_r,
    Birthweight_KG = dbwt
  ) %>%
  mutate(across(c(Before_Pregnancy, Trimester_One, Trimester_Two, Yes_cigarettes_), ~ case_when(
    . == 0 ~ "0",
    . == 1 ~ "1-5",
    . == 2 ~ "6-10",
    . == 3 ~ "11-20",
    . %in% c(4, 5) ~ "21-40",
    TRUE ~ as.character(.)
  ) %>%
```

```{r, echo=FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, results='asis'}
#creates a table with p-values, from most significant to least significant
create_pvalue_tibble <- function(model) {
  summary_df <- summary(model)$coefficients
  result_tibble <- tibble(
    variable = rownames(summary_df)[-1],  
    p_value = summary_df[-1, "Pr(>|t|)"]
  )
  ordered_tibble <- arrange(result_tibble, p_value)
  return(ordered_tibble)
}

# Function to calculate MMSE for a given model
calculate_mmse <- function(model, data) {
  predicted_values <- predict(model, newdata = data)
  squared_residuals <- (data$apgar5 - predicted_values) ^ 2
  mmse <- mean(squared_residuals)
  return(mmse)
}

# Calculate MMSE for each Apgar5 model
apgar5_mmse_values <- sapply(apgar_models, calculate_mmse, data = data_mod)
# Calculate changes in MMSE for Apgar5 models
apgar5_mmse_change <- c(0, diff(apgar5_mmse_values))

# Calculate MMSE for each Birth Weight model
birth_weight_mmse_values <- sapply(birth_weight_models, calculate_mmse, data = data_mod)
# Calculate changes in MMSE for Birth Weight models
birth_weight_mmse_change <- c(0, diff(birth_weight_mmse_values))

# Modify the create_model_tibble function to include MMSE Change
create_model_tibble <- function(model_list, feature_list, mmse_change) {
  # Create basic tibble
  tibble_data <- tibble(
    `Number of Features` = c(length(strsplit(feature_list[1], ", ")[[1]]),
                             length(strsplit(feature_list[2], ", ")[[1]]),
                             length(strsplit(feature_list[3], ", ")[[1]])),
    `Features (Selected by Highest P-value)` = feature_list,
    `Adjusted R-Squared` = signif(sapply(model_list, function(model) summary(model)$adj.r.squared), 3),
    `MMSE Change` = mmse_change
  )

  # Calculate changes in AIC
  aic_values <- sapply(model_list, AIC)
  aic_change <- signif(c(0, diff(aic_values)), 3)

  # Add AIC Change column
  tibble_data <- tibble_data %>%
    mutate(`AIC Change` = aic_change)

  return(tibble_data)
}
```
